reviews.text:
A must visit if you’re at NTU! Amazing architecture that never fails to disappoint in my opinion, though this was my first time visiting.

The tutorial rooms within are very nicely designed too - each table has 2 buttons which are used to toggle the connected computer (I presume) during presentation. Thankfully I think the rooms are unlocked during Open House day so I got to have a peek inside.

Water dispensers (both hot and cold) are also available outside washrooms.

The overall experience of the building is nice. You have daylit spaces as well as dim spaces suiting to the kind of lighting you prefer. The overall architecture and Design by Thomas Heather wick is fabulous. It's a craft piece in its own. Definitely recommend people to visit the space, it's free for all. The building looks over the biggest Engineererd timber building, the New Business School building in NTU.

a beautiful place to chit chat and have a snack that shaped like dim sum bowl (?) but thats the point. you will get mesmerized by it and once you enter you will more mesmerized because the building is so mesmerizing. there are few food stall/mini cafe and vending machine. seats and table and always available. if you go to L3 you will see the beautiful scenery.

look so nice to tourist got what use when its so hard to get to? wondering what was the priority here, accessibility via transport or aesthetics? try getting here on a rainy day and you'll find out the answer

For those who are curious, this location has a lot of tutorial rooms for classes. You can also come here to study independently during your free time.

If my memory serves me well, level 1 has a "communication cube" (also known as the "COMM CUBE") where you can go to ask for assistance with your thesis, project report, résumé, etc. A/C is also present inside.
